1.title: Why Your Website Needs a 2025 Refresh: Top Trends
1.excerpt: Discover the key web design trends dominating 2025, from Bento grids to immersive scroll animations.
content: Web design is constantly evolving. In 2025, we see a return to the essential, but with more personality.
## 1. Functional Minimalism
Sites cluttered with information are 'out'. The focus now is on guiding the user with clarity and generous white space. Less noise, more signal.
## 2. Giant Typography
Huge titles that take up the entire screen. Typography stops being just text and becomes the main graphic element.
## 3. Micro-interactions
Small animations when hovering or clicking that bring the site to life without slowing it down. It's the difference between a static site and one that 'responds'.

2.title: SEO Best Practices for Next.js Applications
2.excerpt: A comprehensive guide to optimizing your Next.js application for search engines to drive organic traffic.
content: Next.js is the framework of choice for modern sites, and Google loves it. But only if configured correctly.
## Server-Side Rendering (SSR)
The big advantage of Next.js. By rendering HTML on the server, we deliver a page ready to read to Google, instead of an empty 'skeleton' that depends on JavaScript.
## Metadata API
Next.js 14+ made managing meta tags incredibly simple. We can generate titles, descriptions, and OG images dynamically for each page.
## Performance is Ranking
Google confirmed that Core Web Vitals are a ranking factor. With the <Image> component and smart font loading, Next.js gives us an immediate competitive edge.

3.title: How Site Speed Impacts Your Conversion Rate
3.excerpt: Learn why every millisecond counts and how optimizing performance can directly boost your bottom line.
content: Nobody likes to wait. On the web, waiting 3 seconds is an eternity.
## The Cost of Slowness
Studies by Amazon and Google show brutal data: 100ms delay can cost 1% in sales. If your site bills €10,000/month, a slightly slow site could be costing you €1,200/year.
## Core Web Vitals
Google measures user experience through metrics like LCP (speed), INP (interactivity), and CLS (visual stability). If you fail these metrics, your site will be penalized in search results.
## How to Optimize
Start with the basics: optimize images (WebP format), use aggressive caching, and eliminate unnecessary JavaScript. If you use WordPress, beware of plugin overload.
At SiteSolutions, we guarantee scores above 90/100 on all projects.

4.title: The Importance of Accessibility in Modern Web Design
4.excerpt: Why building accessible websites is not just an ethical choice but a smart business decision.
content: Web accessibility means ensuring that people with disabilities can use your site. But the benefits go far beyond that.
## SEO and Accessibility
Many accessibility practices (like using alt text on images and correct heading structure) are exactly what Google wants to understand your content.
## Wider Market
About 15% of the world's population has some form of disability. Ignoring accessibility is ignoring a huge slice of the market.
## Legal Risks
Soon, European legislation will make accessibility mandatory for many sectors. Preparing your site now prevents headaches (and fines) in the future.

0.question: What are Core Web Vitals and why do they matter?
0.answer: They are Google's metrics for measuring user experience quality. Since 2021, they are an official ranking factor. If your site fails Core Web Vitals, you are likely losing organic traffic and paying more for ads (CPC).

1.question: How long until I see results?
1.answer: Technical improvements are immediate. Once optimizations are deployed, the site gets faster. However, Google can take up to 28 days to update field data (CrUX) and reflect these improvements in SEO rankings.

2.question: Will this 'break' my site?
2.answer: No. We always work in a staging environment before applying any changes to the live site. We ensure all functionalities, forms, and design remain intact, just faster.

3.question: Do you speed up WordPress or Shopify sites?
3.answer: Yes, we are experts in optimizing WordPress (removing plugin bloat, optimizing themes) and Shopify (improving Liquid and third-party scripts). We also work with Next.js, React, and custom sites.

4.question: What if my site is slow because of the server?
4.answer: If hosting is the bottleneck, we'll tell you. Often, migrating to a modern server or properly configuring a CDN solves bottlenecks that no code optimization could fix.

0.answer: Content SEO is about keywords and text. Technical SEO is about ensuring the site is readable, fast, and structured for search engine robots.

0.question: What is GEO (Generative Engine Optimization)?
0.answer: It is the practice of optimizing content to be cited by AIs like ChatGPT and Gemini. Unlike SEO (blue links), GEO focuses on being the 'single answer' or cited source.

1.question: Does this replace traditional SEO?
1.answer: No, it complements it. SEO brings search traffic; GEO builds authority and captures traffic from virtual assistants. Best practices of one help the other.

2.question: Can you guarantee ChatGPT recommends my company?
2.answer: No one can guarantee. Models are 'black boxes'. We optimize probabilities by providing structured data and authority that AIs favor.

3.question: Is it worth investing now?

4.question: How do you measure results?

faq.question: Do you integrate with my scheduling system?
faq.answer: Yes, we work with most clinical management and scheduling systems. If your system has an API, we can integrate. Otherwise, we can recommend compatible solutions.

faq.question: How much does a clinic website cost?
faq.answer: It depends on complexity: number of pages, necessary integrations, specific functionalities. Contact us for a personalized proposal.

faq.question: Do you handle the content?
faq.answer: We can structure the content and do basic copywriting. For specialized medical content, we recommend that you review or provide the technical information.

faq.question: And maintenance afterwards?
faq.answer: We offer monthly maintenance plans including updates, backups, support, and small changes. Check our plans page.

faq.question: How long does it take?
faq.answer: An institutional clinic website typically takes 3-6 weeks, depending on complexity and feedback speed.

faq.question: Do you help with Google Business Profile?
faq.answer: Yes, we can help optimize your Google Business profile to appear on the map and local searches.
